item.title: Global coronavirus death toll tops 800,000 -AFP tally
item.description: The number of deaths from the new coronavirus has surpassed 800,000 around the world, according to an AFP tally based on official sources at around 1100 GMT on Saturday.

item.title: Solons accuse senators of showboating on Bayanihan 2 for reelection
item.description: Members of the House of Representatives on Saturday accused senators of showboating in hopes of re-election after they made several remarks on the consolidated bill of the Bayanihan to Recover as One Act or Bayanihan 2.

item.title: Gandhi's iconic glasses sell for $340,000 in UK
item.description: A pair of gold-plated glasses worn by Indian independence hero Mahatma Gandhi has sold in Britain for £260,000 (about 288,000 euros, $340,000), the auction house said.

item.title: Kremlin critic Navalny 'stable' in Berlin hospital
item.description: Kremlin critic and opposition leader Alexei Navalny, who has suffered a suspected poisoning, was in a stable condition in hospital on Saturday after being flown to Berlin following a standoff over his medical evacuation from Russia.

item.title: DA agency grants loan to produce dairy products for students in Palawan
item.description: The Department of Agriculture (DA), through one of its attached agencies, has granted a loan to a farm destination in Palawan to help produce dairy products for school children, especially those in public schools.

item.title: COVID-19 cases in House of Representatives now at 51
item.description: The House of Representatives on Saturday reported a new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infection, bringing the total tally of cases in the agency to 51.

item.title: Karapatan seeks release of PNP reports on activist killings
item.description: Militant rights group Karapatan on Saturday called on the Philippine National Police (PNP) to release investigation reports on activist and rights defender killings.

item.title: Ombudsman suspension of officials unrelated to probes --PhilHealth
item.description: The Philippine Health Insurance Corporation on Saturday said that the six-month preventive suspension order against 13 of its officials did not stem from the hearings conducted by the Congress on the alleged corruption in the agency.

item.title: Philippines reports 4,933 new COVID-19 cases; total surpasses 187,000
item.description: The Philippines on Saturday reported 4,933 new coronavirus disease 2019 (COVID-19) infections, bringing the nationwide tally of cases to 187,249, according to the Department of Health (DOH).

item.title: Gatchalian says each city, municipality should have permanent evacuation center
item.description: Senator Sherwin Gatchalian on Saturday said there should be a permanent evacuation center in each city and municipality.

item.title: Palace on SWS's 'quality of life' poll: Recovery plan in place to cushion pandemic's impact
item.description: Malacañang on Saturday expressed concern over the result of the latest SWS survey showing 36% of working age Filipinos expecting their lives to worsen in the next 12 months, but said the government has already laid down a recovery plan.

item.title: 36% of adult Pinoys expect quality of life to worsen in next 12 months --SWS
item.description: Thirty six percent of adult Filipinos are expecting that their quality of life will worsen in the upcoming 12 months, a Social Weather Stations survey found.

item.title: Ex-SC spokesman urges high court: Speak more often on pressing issues
item.description: Former Supreme Court spokesperson, and now human rights advocate Atty. Theodore “Ted” Te on Saturday called on the high tribunal to take a stand on pressing issues.

item.title: PNP denies Duterte ordered them to withhold info on activist killings from CHR
item.description: The Philippine National Police on Saturday denied the claim that President Rodrigo Duterte ordered them to withhold information related to the investigation into the killings of activists and rights defenders.

item.title: Tricycle driver sa Boracay, naaksidente dahil sa pagsusuot ng face shield
item.description: BORACAY ISLAND --Naaksidente ang isang tricycle driver sa Boracay at nangangambang maputulan ng isang daliri matapos maaksidente sa daan.
